Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Lactococcus lactis (MIC=3 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=50 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=12.5 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=12.5 µg/ml).(Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In 50% (by vol.) trifluoroethanol, an NMR study and structure calculations indicate that uperin 3.6 adopts a well-defined amphipathic alpha-helix with distinct hydrophilic and hydrophobic faces.(Ref.1)
Sequence Information.Function: Shows antibacterial activity gaginst several Gram-positive bacteria. This peptide could inhibit HIV infection at a concentration that is also toxic to T cells (J Virol 2005; 79

Literature.Title: The solution structure of uperin 3.6, an antibiotic peptide from the granular dorsal glands of the Australian toadlet, Uperoleia mjobergii.
Literature.Author: Chia BC, Carver JA, Mulhern TD, Bowie JH.

Literature.Title: Host-defence peptides of Australian anurans structure, mechanism of action and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Apponyi MA, Pukala TL, Brinkworth CS, Maselli VM, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Booker GW, Wallace JC, Carver JA, Separovic F, Doyle J, Llewellyn LE.

Literature.Title: New antibiotic uperin peptides from the dorsal glands of the australian toadlet Uperoleia mjobergii.
Literature.Author: Wallace J.C.,Tyler M.J.,Bowie J.H.,Bradford A.M.
